item.title: Bent functions construction using extended Maiorana-McFarland class
item.description: arXiv:2403.19676v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Bent functions are balanced by restricting their domains to vectors with either even or odd Hamming weights, which ensures an equal number of pre-images for both, 0 and 1. Using the previous fact, we find bent functions whose domains are the set of vectors with even Hamming weight or the set of vectors with odd Hamming weight. Additionally, we employ the extended Maiorana-McFarland class to obtain bent functions. Furthermore, the func tions produced are balanced when we restrict their domain to vectors with even Hamming weights. We also conduct specific comparisons of the Walsh Hadamard transform in relation to both the original bent functions and the newly generated ones. With all the necessary tools, we present an algorithm that leverages the Maiorana-McFarland approach repeatedly to generate new bent functions of any dimension.
item.dc:creator: Juan Carlos Ku-Cauich, Javier Arturo D\'iaz-Vargas, Sara Mandujano-Velazquez

item.title: Definite integrals involving Bessel functions expressed as a series of special functions
item.description: arXiv:2502.14876v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Series involving hypergeometric functions are used to derive, extend and evaluate integrals involving the product of two Bessel functions of the first kind $J_{u}(a z)$ $J_{v}(b z)$ with order $u,v$, studied by Landau et al. The method used in this work is contour integration.
item.dc:creator: Robert Reynolds
